result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael R. Kraemer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with 22CM52 and any probation now serving.

miscConds.notes:
If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Days credit to be determined if revoked.

You must submit to and successfully complete a mental health evaluation to determine appropriate programming commensurate with needs identified.  Must comply with all recommendations.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Must pay all costs of supervision and court ordered financial obligations during the term of probation. 

DNA already on file.
Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person or by any other means with Victim unless approved by agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael R. Kraemer

defendant.name: Kraemer, Michael R.
defendant.address: 311 Pine Street, Black River Falls, WI 54615

records.addlTxt:
2:16 PM Defendant Michael R. Kraemer appeared by video.  Attorney Carly June Sebion appeared by video for Michael R. Kraemer.  Attorney Crystal Leigh Jensen in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant agrees to continue remotely.  State is in victim rights compliance. Pleads no contest to count 1 in 22CF82, pleads no contest on count 1 in 22CM52, charges in 22CF100 DRI.
 Court reviewed the elements and potential penalties of the charge the defendant plead to.  He understood.   Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. He understood. Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of Disorderly Conduct (1) contrary to 947.01(1) ; Domestic Abuse Incident (1), contrary to 968.075(1)(a) in case 22CF82.  Found guilty of  Disorderly Conduct (1) contrary to 947.01(1) with Domestic Abuse Incident (1) contrary to 968.075(1)(a); Habitual Criminality (1) contrary to 939.62(1)(a).  Charges in 22CF100 are DRI for sentencing purposes. Defendant did not exercise his right to allocution.

Joint recommendation of  a withheld sentence 2 years probation w/ conditions of costs, DNA (on file) Any conditions ordered by agent including AODA, Mental Health evaluation and follow through. No contact with victim unless approved by agent.

Court adopts joint recommendation orders sentence withheld 2 years probation concurrent and with other probation on now, AODA, mental health eval, risk and needs and follow through with all.  DNA on file. No contact with victim unless the victim requests through agent and is approved through agent.  Court costs. contact probation agent. Has appointment on 10/17 with probation agent okay to wait until then to get set up with probation with these new cases. 

Credit to be determined if he is revoked.
